chat_history.message:
Hello,
My Galaxy S20+ has a problem:
The screen suddenly got a green line.
Thank you,

The customer confirms that the device has not been opened or repaired by a third party, exposed to water, or suffered damage from impact or fall. (Spanish)

Hola, agente
El vendedor no puede proceder al reenvío debido al siguiente motivo:
El artículo está bloqueado por un código o patrón.
Se ha añadido más información en este mensaje: Dear Backcare, 

We confirm the receipt of the device, however after inspecting, we found that the phone is locked by code, as shown in the image attached. Please inform us of the code to unlock the phone so that we can perform the necessary actions.
Thank you.

Regards,
TB

Dear ecomobile

I hope you're having a great day!
This is Kevin from Back Market Customer Care

Please remember that according to the Quality Charter:
3.5.3 DELETING YOUR CUSTOMER’S DATA
After you receive the returned device, you must fully restore it and delete your customer’s data if they haven’t done so already. If the item is locked, you must:

➜ Never ask for your customer’s credentials.
If a user account (e.g. iCloud, Google) is still connected to iCloud, you could use the following steps: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/What-to-do-with-a-device-locked-to-iCloud

If you have any questions about the process, you should contact the Seller Support Center (SSC) if you would like further clarification on this topic. You would easily find the answers to your questions there. Just click on this link, and you will be taken to the home page of your help center: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/login

Reminder: If this is the first time you go to the SSC, you must create a new account, as this is a separate platform. You can use the same credentials as your back office if you want, or different ones if you prefer.

Thanks for your help in keeping our shared customers happy!

Regards,
Kevin from the Back Care Team

Dear Backcare,

We take note of this.

Regards,
JY

Hi ecomobile,

Just a friendly reminder that the customer is waiting for their >>repaired device<<.

We have listed some issues with their corresponding resolutions here in case these are preventing you from carrying out the refund. Please use the ""Report a Problem"" button on the bottom of the screen to declare an issue with the customer's return and stop a refund from being made on your behalf.

1. In case of a delivery issue: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/How-to-manage-a-transport-issue-lost-stolen-damaged-parcel

2. In case of a user account (e.g. iCloud, Google) still connected:
iCloud:
https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/What-to-do-with-a-device-locked-to-iCloud
Google: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/How-to-manage-a-product-blocked-with-an-account-Android-Google

3. In case of a warranty exclusion: https://backmarketportal.force.com/ssc/s/article/Declare-and-manage-warranty-exclusion

➜ Please provide a solution to the customer within the next (1) business day, or unfortunately we’ll have to refund the order, tomorrow at morning, according to the Back Market Quality Charter.

Thanks for your help in keeping our shared customers happy!
Kevin Back Market customer Care

Dear Backcare,

Unfortunately, our repair team is unable to fix the issue, and we do not have sufficient stock for an exchange. We have processed the refund. Thank you for your understanding.

Regards, 
KW
